meanings.definition: A cord or string used to fasten a garment.
meanings.sent1: She tied the lacet of her dress tightly.
meanings.sent2: The lacet on his shoe broke, so he couldn't tie it.
meanings.sent3: The lacet on the hoodie got tangled with the drawstring.
meanings.sent4: The lacet of friendship binds us together.
meanings.sent5: The lacet fluttered in the wind as she ran.

meanings.definition: To fasten or secure with a lace or cord.
meanings.sent1: He will lacet his shoes before going for a walk.
meanings.sent2: She needed to lacet the tent to keep it from blowing away.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to lacet the rings together for his trick.
meanings.sent4: The team worked together to lacet the pieces of the puzzle.
meanings.sent5: She carefully lacet the ribbon around the gift box.
